intro: Draba furcipila, commonly known as the forked rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Draba furcipila has basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate, and its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer. It is often found in high-altitude environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climatic conditions.
